name: CyberRangeCZ Practical Modules
description: Learning sequence for subcase 1a in the CyberRangeCZ environment, aimed at instructors and trainees.

activities.description: The instructor defines objectives, materials and timings for the session within the CyberRangeCZ control panel.
The activity is scheduled in the Random Education Platform (REP) by assigning the introductory modules.
The instructor starts the live session, presents objectives and enables the collaborative channels (chat, videoconferencing, whiteboard).
REP automatically distributes short theory capsules and guided simulations to each trainee.
Trainees answer interactive quizzes with immediate feedback.
The instructor reviews real-time results to identify questions and reinforce key points.
Supervised labs or challenges linked to the theoretical content are launched.
REP consolidates results and produces a report the instructor uses for the final feedback session.
The instructor activates a spear phishing campaign combining email, SMS and voice to assess the trainees' initial response.
Trainees inspect attack vectors, report suspicious indicators and document findings in REP forms.
A coordination room is created to activate the response chain, integrating secure chat, videoconferencing and a task board in REP.
Trainees assign roles, share evidence and validate countermeasures through the instructor's collaborative console.
Critical artefacts from the exercise (headers, logs, captures) are collected to feed the express report.
The instructor compiles findings and recommendations in the express forensic report template and shares it with participants.
